programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie decides his staff need to work harder and vows to sack the next employee he catches slacking. Mrs Cakeworthy is the first out the door, but she soon has her boss regretting his decision when he learns she is a witch. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Ella Kenion star.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan is assigned to investigate the case of two murdered teenage girls whose frozen bodies have been uncovered by an avalanche in Norway. Post-mortem results show they were strangled 15 years apart and as investigations proceed, suspicion falls on a friend of one victim's family. Drama, starring Amanda Burton and Anthony Head.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Fern Britton hosts another culinary showdown, judged this week by Rosemary Shrager, who begins by demonstrating how to peel, cut and slice pears into fans, before giving the contestants five minutes to copy what she has just done. Six hopefuls go through to the next stage where they have to French trim pork chops, before the final three use the meat to create the best pork dish they can.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The VW Beetle begins to take shape as auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and expert mechanic Edd China continue their restoration, but things do not go according to plan.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton visits Germany, where he discovers a nuclear core from a secret Nazi weapon-testing factory.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr and Paul Sr have a meeting away from the cameras to discuss their relationship, while OCC finishes a bike for MyPillow and PJD begins a build for a baseball player.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: Documentary examining Russia's massive bomber planes, including the Bear, Bison and Badger, which kept Nato on alert during the Cold War.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to Windsorland Mobile Home Park, where he finds the production of mannequins is not only dirty but also difficult.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the Koenigsegg One:1, revealing its inner workings and impressive exterior.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: How a BMW i8 is made, featuring a trip to its birthplace.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Sometimes blood relations lead to bloodshed - when murder becomes a family affair. Here, investigators turn to forensics to uncover sinister plots within families.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When the body of Fernando Silva was found, the crime scene revealed little about what caused his death. Police turned to CCTV to find out what happened.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of retired Michigan police officer Michael Greene and his wife Terri in their home. Police found evidence of a personal grudge as a possible motive for the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Experts uncover evidence linking the abduction of a 10-year-old boy to his father's new wife, after the man became suspicious and raised the alarm.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Jim Boller leads the mission to rescue a deer that has sustained severe injuries after running through a plate-glass window at an office.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to treat a puppy born with a cleft palate, and receives a call from worried lifeguards when snakes hit the beach.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a family dog with life-threatening heat stroke, and a terrier with a fear of skateboards. He also needs to collect some alligator saliva.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Monisha has come to Kleinfeld's looking for a dress for her three wedding ceremonies, while Mary has a budget of $30,000 to buy two gowns.
